item.title: The Pandemic and Peacefulness Part I
item.description:
Introduction

No talking, no exercising, no reading, no writing, and no technology. We, over 200 men and women — ranging from ardent atheists to devout Hindus and from Rajasthani farmers to European travelers — came together on the outskirts of Jaipur, India, for ten days in January. In silence, we meditated. It is now, in quarantine, I realize genuinely how significant this meditation retreat was for me.
